results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Giorgio Mangiamele, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.

Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.

results.title: [Visit to Healesville Sanctuary by Princess Alexandra]

results.title: Destination: Port of Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Norman Godbold and Pan Pacific Pictures
results.brief_description: Follows the docking of a container ship. Aerial views show the layout of the port and ground shots provide a feeling of great activity in the port.

results.title: A Pace ahead
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Australian Dairy Board
results.brief_description: Research is the basis for new and improved products from the dairy industry. Experimental farms test new breeds of cattle, pastures and fodder harvesting and conservation. Shows milk production, butter making, cheese making, and the by-products of casein and malt, and considers the nearby eastern countries as a tremendous market.

results.title: The Life of Harry Dare
results.creator_credit: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission and Infinity Pictures
results.brief_description: Harry Dare’s troubles began the day he sighted the Kombi van and despite the warnings of ‘Bad Spirit Trouble’, he just had to have it. When the van is stolen, Harry embarks on a journey with his young estranged son Jim to find it. What Harry really discovers is a more meaningful relationship with his son. Stars John Moore as Harry and Aaron Wilton as Jim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission and Infinity Pictures

results.title: Punkline
results.creator_credit: Tony Stevens, Sue Davis and Kali Productions
results.brief_description: Shot at the Crystal Ballroom and Festival Hall during performances of the B 52’s, The Cure, La Femme and The Models, this film provides an observation not of the New Wave performers, but of the people who go to see them. Soundtrack from a tape by Equal Local.

results.title: Film work
results.creator_credit: John Hughes and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: This film recalls the work of the Waterside Workers’ Federation Film Unit. Financed by several trade unions, the Unit produced eleven (mainly documentary) films between 1953-58. There are excerpts from four of the films ‘Pensions for Veterans’, ‘The Hungry Miles’, ‘November Victory’ and ‘Hewers of Coal’ and interviews with the Unit members, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Jock Levy. (Awards: ATOM 1982)
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hughes and Waterside Workers’ Federation of Australia. Film Unit.

results.title: [Len Moncur Home Movies: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
The Len Moncur Home Movie Collection is a collection of amateur films made on 8mm film in the 1950s and 1960s.

This animated film, titled ‘Storm at the 20th’, is a comedy about a group of beleaguered golf ball people, often wearing golf tee hats and with pipe cleaner limbs, who come together to protest against injury from golfers. They decide to take evasive action including using feathers to fly out of the way of golf sticks and a self-destructing do-it-yourself glider kit.

There are details such as the terrible injuries inflicted by golfers and one of the organisers drinking non-stop from what looks like a whiskey bottle.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:07:00 title cards ‘Storm at the 20th’ and ‘Animation by Len Moncur’
00:00:10:00 golf ball people are rushing around a busy street
00:00:18:00 a sign ‘Protest Meeting - Every Brand - Even repaints – Something must be done!’
00:00:26:00 sign ‘Trades Hall 20th Hole Branch’
00:00:29:00 wonderful miniature and detailed vehicles pass by including a tram from which many golf ball people alight
00:00:38:00 close-up of ‘Before it happens towing service’ tow truck
00:00:43:00 golf ball mechanics fix a broken down vehicle
00:00:50:00 an injured golf ball mechanic is taken away by stretcher and ambulance
00:01:16:00 the protest meeting proceeds with the manifesto stating that golf ball people are being treated badly by golfers
00:01:25:00 one of the organisers drinking strong spirits followed by several examples of gruesome golf ball injuries
00:02:35:00 baby golf ball people in a bassinette
00:02:48:00 the golf ball people learn evasive tactics on the golf course
00:04:33:00 boxes labelled ‘Do it yourself Glider Kit’ followed by a demonstration of how the glider assists the golf ball person avoid being hit by a golfer by flying through the air and then self-destructing once the golf ball person shields in a bush
00:05:09:00 the golf ball people squash into their sporty car and after travelling down the road, pop themselves into their boxes
00:05:24:00 title ‘The End’

results.title: [Wallace Clarke Home Movies: Reel 26]
results.brief_description:
Wallace Clarke was an amateur cinematographer and filmmaker during the 1960s to the 1990s. Wallace was particularly keen on capturing both the Australian landscape and the people who enjoyed it. As well as Australian urban settings and some world travels, Wallace’s films focus on the many hiking and camping destinations that he visited.

Often carrying the credit, ‘A Walkabout Film’, Wallace’s movies indicate that he was part of a nature study and walking group called ‘The Walkabouters Club of Victoria Inc’. The ‘Walkabouters’ formed in 1968 as a result of a Council of Adult Education (CAE), Outback Study Tour to Central Australia’. Some of the attendees decided to start the Club in order to continue educative walks particularly around Victoria. The Club encouraged their resident artists and photographers to capture their activities.

The collection of Wallace’s films was donated to ACMI by his widow Gwenda Clarke and is shot on various formats, predominantly Standard 8mm and Super 8mm film.

This film is situated in the Victorian Alpine Region in the summer months when the only snows are at the very top of the mountains. Wallace focuses on the roads that wind, at times dramatically, through the mountain range as well as the surrounding landscape of trees, rocks and waterways.

Originally made on Super 8mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 titles ‘WHC Presents’, ‘The Victorian Alps’
00:00:50:00 views from the road and a small old house
00:01:06:00 sign ‘Alpine Road’ with lots of information for the traveller
00:01:25:00 sign ‘You are now entering Mount Hotham Alpine Reserve’
00:01:35:00 looking across a corner of a dirt road high up in the mountains
00:02:22:00 roads, signs and aerials on top of the mountains and a melting snowman
00:02:58:00 brass sundial
00:04:46:00 sign warning to ‘keep to the left of the poles’ and directional sign to ‘Hotham, Diamentina, Harrietville’
00:05:20:00 chair lift pulley station and 1970s style four wheel drive vehicle, a chalet and hamlet
00:05:55:00 a small A-frame chalet or hut
00:06:30:00 views of roads, trees and cars with the mountains in the background
00:07:05:00 two purple swamp hens (common to wetlands or rivers of Eastern Australia)
00:07:50:00 signs ‘Mount Buffalo’ and ‘Eurobin Falls’ followed by views of cascading waters over rocky embankments and cliffs
00:08:30:00 sign ‘Mackeys Lookout’ followed by views out over the valleys below including cars negotiating the tight turns on the roads winding down the mountain
00:09:08:00 sign ‘Rollarson’s Falls’
00:09:35:00 hikers negotiate logs and rocks along the path
00:10:16:00 a long narrow waterfall into a lovely natural rock pool
00:11:00:00 looking out over misty valleys through an old walk bridge
00:13:08:00 a narrow waterfall in a rocky cliffface
00:13:36:00 snow along the sides of the road
00:14:26:00 sign ‘Toownag Gap, Mt Buffalo, Mt Bogong’ and a visitor looking through binoculars from a lookout
00:14:46:00 looking down from a higher vantage spot on a long windy road through the mountains toward a township beyond
00:15:20:00 views of electricity towers across the ranges
00:15:50:00 sign ‘Pretty Valley Branch East Kiewa River’
00:16:11:00 sign ‘rocky Valley Dam’ and scenes around the dam
00:17:05:00 sign ‘Strawberry Saddle’ followed by a mob of emus
00:18:07:00 sign ‘Bundara River’ in the Victorian Alpine Region
00:19:50:00 sign ‘Omeo’, Victoria, followed by an older style cattle truck travelling along a street and the Public Telegraph Office in the township
